item.description:

item.title: Top of Ravenshaw Street, 24th January
item.description:
The removal of the cycle and e scooter bay has not stopped users of these bikes dumping them regardless on the road. They are now parked illegally in parking bays and now taking up even more space than ever. People are finding them dumped on their cars and yesterday witnessed users knock down a parked motorcycle trying to get to a lime bike.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1A, Ravenshaw Street, West Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dozens of dog faeces every day, 24th January
item.description:
The entire area surrounding Eyot House - whether it's Old Jamaica Road, Sun Passage, or Marine Street - is littered with dozens of dog faeces, forcing people to zig zag while walking. People inevitably sooner or later step into one, then take it into the lobby in Eyot House, up the stairs, etc. It's disgusting and the Council needs to do something about it urgently please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Frean Street, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Series of potholes close to 88 Mount Pleasant, 24th January
item.description:
Deep potholes close to 88 Mount Pleasant on the side of the road heading South East going up Mount Pleasant from the roundabout towards Cockfosters Road. Hard to avoid when cars parked and cars travelling on the opposite side of the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mount Pleasant, East Barnet, Greater London

item.title: Overhanging holly tree at face level, 24th January
item.description:
There is a holly tree that hangs over the fence on the mead (the property is on Albemarle Road) and the holly is encroaching more and more over the fence. It is at face height and several times now I’ve seen it too late and been spiked in the face (once it drew blood on my eyelid and eyebrow). Please can the owners of the property be asked to cut this down so it is flush with the fence (it’s not a very wide pavement there either). Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Meadway, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The place is a dump, 24th January
item.description:
The road is full of rubbish, the bushes are full of rubbish. People stop sit on the bench, drink, chuck their glass bottles in the road. Scooter riders turn up and go to the toilet in the bushes, Please clean the area and get rid of the bushes, they are just attracting degenerates.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Swiftsden Way, Downham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poor pavement access and rubble/debris, 24th January
item.description:
Building works for a large development of flats on Downsbridge Road (by mini roundabout) have been ongoing for a long time now (probably 2-3 years). The pavement/verge outside the property on Downsbridge Road has over this time become increasingly damaged and unsightly. The area that has been cordoned off has gradually increased in length. They no longer have large construction trucks going in and out so there should be no reason why they cannot tidy this area up; it is a disgrace. Even if they are still working there, they should have standards that they should be made to adhere to. At this point in the project they really should be no reason why they pavement cannot be tidied up and reinstated. It’s gone on for long enough and they should be told to do a remedial tidy up now and a more thorough one once the works are completed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Downsbridge Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Voi rental bikes, 24th January
item.description:
Since Voi bikes have been introduced they have consistently been left outside the cycle hire bay, both on double yellow lines and in normal parking spaces, and often on the pavement. They are usually fallen, as in this photograph.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Albion Drive, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
